;

;2024 年总统选举有望与其他现代美国选举不同。

;

;领先领域共和党总统候选人中的佼佼者是前总统唐纳德·特朗普，他因试图推翻 2020 年选举中输给民主党人乔·拜登的努力而面临一系列联邦和州刑事指控。

;

;现任总统拜登是假定的民主党候选人。 2024 年 11 月举行选举时，他将年满 81 岁，如果能连任，他将成为赢得总统选举的最年长的美国人。

;

;77 岁的特朗普正在主导;一大群候选人;基本上避免批评他与 2020 年选举相关的行为因为担心疏远他的顽固支持者基础。许多支持者相信特朗普关于选举被窃取的虚假说法。

;

;他的共和党竞争对手，例如佛罗里达州州长罗恩·德桑蒂斯和前美国驻联合国大使尼基·黑利，则认为特朗普的合法权利困境将阻碍他在大选中对抗拜登。

;

;两个值得注意的例外是特朗普的前副总统迈克·彭斯和前新泽西州州长克里斯·克里斯蒂，他们都谴责特朗普试图颠覆 2020 年的总统选举

;

;企业家维韦克·拉马斯瓦米 (Vivek Ramaswamy) 是一位政治新人，他作为特朗普民粹主义“美国优先”议程的继承者参选，这一议程对扩张性的联邦政府、企业权力和国际联盟持谨慎态度。

;

;

;

; p>;

;德桑蒂斯曾被视为最有可能拒绝特朗普提名的候选人，但;尽管他拥有大量资金，但自 5 月份启动以来，他的竞选活动一直进展缓慢;。他有可能落入特朗普身后的其他人之列。

;

;民意调查显示;特朗普在正面交锋中很大程度上与拜登势均力敌;，尽管就业增长、基础设施建设良好，但选民仍担心拜登的年龄和他对经济的处理投资和通胀在去年达到峰值后缓慢放缓。

;

;;特朗普因破坏 2020 年大选、对机密文件处理不当以及参与涉及色情明星的“封口费”计划而在联邦和州法院面临四起案件的起诉;。他坚称自己无罪，并辩称自己是出于政治动机的起诉的受害者，但拜登政府否认了这一说法。这些案件的法律日历;对特朗普的竞选能力构成了障碍;。

;

;虽然选民可能并不热情，但民主党领导人正在支持拜登和他的副总统卡马拉·哈里斯。

;

;自助作家兼演说家玛丽安·威廉姆森正在向拜登发起一项长期挑战。拜登，但没有成熟的民主党人参加竞选。

;

;拜登的第二个四年任期取决于他对经济的管理，因为经济已经从新冠病毒大流行中恢复过来，并且;他所说的;“美国灵魂之战， “与特朗普结盟的共和党人的斗争。

;

;在拜登的领导下，失业率;跌至世代低点;，国内生产总值（GDP）增长快于预期，工资上涨。然而，去年通胀飙升，尽管近几个月有所缓解，但选民仍然对食品、燃料、汽车和住房等主要生活必需品的高价感到担忧。

;

;如果特朗普成为共和党候选人，拜登竞选活动的大部分内容可能会集中在特朗普提出的;警告选民;上对美国民主的致命威胁。

;

;美国著名政治家族的后裔、反疫苗活动家小罗伯特·F·肯尼迪 (Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.) 发起了独立竞选，而不是挑战拜登获得民主党提名。肯尼迪表现出了一些;上诉; 共和党人和民主党人都对拜登与特朗普的另一场比赛不感兴趣。

;

;进步活动家科内尔·韦斯特也表示，他将以独立人士身份参选。两位候选人面临的挑战将是积累足够的支持，以便明年在所有 50 个州参加投票。

;

;共和党将于 1 月份在爱荷华州预选会议上举行首次提名竞赛。此后不久，新罕布什尔州将举行总统初选，随后是内华达州、南卡罗来纳州和密歇根州。

;

;民主党计划二月份在南卡罗来纳州举行首次初选，预计拜登不会面临严峻的挑战者。 “超级星期二”——包括加利福尼亚州和得克萨斯州在内的十多个州将在 3 月 5 日授予代表大会代表。

;

;各政党将提名在各自政党代表大会上获得最多代表的候选人提名大会将于 2024 年夏季举行。共和党将在威斯康星州密尔沃基举行大会，民主党将在芝加哥举行大会。

;

;大选将于 2024 年 11 月 5 日举行。

;

;堕胎：民主党计划将堕胎作为 2024 年竞选活动的核心，并提出;意见民意调查显示;大多数美国人不赞成严格限制生育权。对于那些支持堕胎权的人来说，这个问题比那些反对堕胎权的人更具激励性，该党希望对这些权利的威胁能够鼓励数百万妇女和独立人士明年投票支持堕胎权。

;

;这个问题让共和党人产生了分歧，;一些领导人担心;自从美国最高法院去年推翻了 1973 年罗伊诉韦德案的里程碑式裁决，终止了对堕胎的宪法保护以来，该党在州级限制方面走得太远了。

;

;共和党总统候选人在支持堕胎法方面存在分歧。应由各州和支持全国禁令的人来决定。

;

;经济：拜登的白宫正试图向美国人保证，经济状况良好，通胀放缓，失业率处于历史最低水平。半个世纪。

;

;共和党人表示，他们将削减联邦支出，他们将其归咎于加剧通货膨胀并引发消费者价格飙升，削减联邦法规并降低税收。

;

;民主党人认为经济健康，工资上涨，基础设施投资正在带来长期就业增长。

;

;选民仍然不相信。路透社/益普索;9 月份的民意调查发现; 27% 的拜登 2020 年选民表示，他们的财务状况比疫情之前“更弱”，而 28% 的人表示自己“更好”，42% 的人表示“大致相同”。;

;移民：自2021年上任以来，;拜登一直在努力解决; 非法穿越美墨边境的移民数量创下历史新高，导致那里的资源以及他们所前往的城市（例如纽约和芝加哥）紧张。包括特朗普在内的共和党候选人;指责拜登; 扭转了特朗普时代限制性更强的政策，并承诺加强边境安全。

;

;一些民主党人批评拜登转向特朗普式的执法措施来减少非法越境，而白宫却坚持这样做正在通过为移民合法入境提供新的方式，转向更加人性化和有序的系统。

;

;犯罪：全国范围内的暴力犯罪水平仍高于 2019 年，即新冠疫情大流行和动乱发生的前一年。种族正义。两党美国人都对此表示担忧，在 9 月份的路透社/益普索民意调查中，88% 的受访者表示犯罪将是决定谁获得选票的一个重要问题。

;

;外交政策：;中国已成为竞选中的外交政策问题;，共和党人认为亚洲力量正在不断增长对国家安全、美国企业利益和台湾独立的威胁。

;

;;拜登政府表示;希望与中国“去风险”而不是“脱钩”，并努力保持世界各国之间的竞争第一和第二经济大国的冲突升级。

;

;乌克兰是另一个重大问题，它已经分裂了共和党阵营。特朗普和德桑蒂斯认为，拜登在乌克兰与俄罗斯的战争中支持乌克兰，分散了美国为可能与中国发生对抗做准备的注意力。彭斯和黑利等其他共和党候选人表示，美国必须继续支持乌克兰。

;

;以色列与哈马斯之间突然爆发的暴力事件给竞选带来了一个两极分化的新问题。坚定支持以色列的拜登面临许多民主党人的异议，他们担心哈马斯控制的加沙地带日益严重的人道主义危机。共和党人也支持以色列，并利用这场冲突来要求加强美墨边境。

;

;两党都在中西部举行代表大会，这充分说明了他们对密歇根州、宾夕法尼亚州和威斯康星州的重视，所有这些都在 2016 年支持特朗普，并在 2020 年转向拜登。

;

;事实证明，亚利桑那州、佐治亚州和内华达州也存在严重分歧，并且人口不断增长，这些人口可能会决定下一次选举。明年的另一个关键战场可能是北卡罗来纳州，这是另一个选民日益多元化的南方州。

;美国最大的州经济体和世界顶级经济体之一的加利福尼亚州州长将于下周前往中国与国家和省级领导人讨论气候行动和其他重要伙伴关系。

;

;加文·纽瑟姆此行是在拜登政府高级官员一系列中国访问之后进行的，其中包括财政部长珍妮特·耶伦、国务卿安东尼·布林肯、特使约翰·克里 (John Kerry) 和商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多 (Gina Raimondo) 就气候问题进行了会谈。

;

;为期一周的访问将包括北京、香港、上海以及广东省和江苏省，预计他将在这些地方签署谅解备忘录在气候倡议上进行合作。

;

;“作为世界上最大的两个经济体，我们的伙伴关系对于为我们的社区及其他地区采取气候行动至关重要，”纽森在周三的一份声明中表示。

;

;纽瑟姆一直在建立国家形象，作为严格气候行动的代言人，最近;上个月在联合国气候雄心峰会上，因谴责石油公司阻碍气候政策的演讲而赢得掌声。

;

;加州连续两年获得国际关注最近可能对全球贸易伙伴产生影响的政策：到 2035 年禁止销售新型燃气发动机汽车，以及对在加州运营的公司实行严格的气候披露规则。

;

;纽瑟姆将讨论清洁能源转型和甲烷减排在北京。这些是克里和他的同行在 7 月份访问期间讨论的核心话题。

;

;中国作为世界上最大的甲烷排放国，尚未公布其;尽管克里团队鼓励这样做，但仍计划采取甲烷减排战略。

;由于抵押贷款利率飙升和供应紧张，降低了许多首次购房者的负担能力，9 月份美国现有房屋销售跌至 13 年来的最低点。

;;在庆祝中华人民共和国成立70周年阅兵式上，搭载DF-5B洲际弹道导弹的军车驶过天安门广场， 2019 年 10 月 1 日，中国北京国庆节。路透社/Jason Lee/档案照片;
;

;中国的武库中拥有超过 500 枚可使用的核弹头，到那时可能会拥有超过 1,000 枚核弹头五角大楼在周四发布的北京军事年度报告中表示，到2030年，尽管中国的核武器数量不断增加，但仍远低于俄罗斯和美国。

;

; p>;

;The United States has a stockpile of about 3,700 nuclear warheads, of which roughly 1,419 strategic nuclear warheads were deployed. Russia has about 1,550 nuclear weapons deployed and according to the Federation of American Scientists, a stockpile of 4,489 nuclear warheads.

;

;In the wide ranging report, the Pentagon said China's more than 500 warheads as of May 2023 were on track to exceed projections.

;

;In a previous report, the Pentagon estimated that Beijing had more than 400 operational nuclear warheads in 2021.

;

;"We see the PRC (People's Republic of China) continuing to quite rapidly modernize and diversify and expand its nuclear forces," a senior US official told reporters during a briefing on the report.

;

;"What they're doing now if you compare it to what they were doing about a decade ago, it really far exceeds that in terms of scale and complexity," the official said.

;

;The report added that China's Navy had more than 370 ships and submarines, up from the 340 ships they had last year.

;

;The expanding naval force is central to President Xi Jinping's bid to make China the preeminent military power in the region and Beijing already has the largest Navy in the world.

;

;The report reiterated concern about pressure by Beijing on self-ruled Taiwan, an island China sees as a breakaway province.

;

;Relations between China and the United States have been tense, with friction between the world's two largest economies over everything from Taiwan and China's human rights record to its military activity in the South China Sea.

;

;But Washington has been eager to revive military-to-military communications with China.

;

;Last week the Pentagon said it had accepted an invitation to attend China's top annual security forum in late October, the latest sign of potentially warming ties between the two countries' militaries.

;Ukrainian authorities and many people in Ukraine had for years seen the UOC as loyal to Moscow, and cracked down on the church after Russia's full-scale invasion in February 2022. Tensions ;have surfaced; across the country.

;A government commission has ruled that the UOC is still canonically linked to Russia despite the church declaring that it cut ties with the Russian Orthodox Church in May 2022.

;UOC Metropolitan Pavlo has been notified he is suspected of inciting inter-religious hatred and distributing materials justifying Russian aggression. He has denied the accusations.

;Ukraine's Security Service said on Thursday 68 criminal cases, including accusations of treason, had been initiated against UOC representatives since Russia's invasion last year.

;Political analyst Volodymyr Fesenko said a ban on the UOC was unlikely to halt its activities and could be challenged in Ukraine and at the European Court of Human Rights.

; Thu, 19 Oct 2023 22:25:03 +0800 In France and Germany, Palestinian supporters say they struggle to be heardhttps://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians-europe-protests/in-france-and-germany-palestinian-supporters-say-they-struggle-to-be-heard-idUSKBN31J1HX
;;2023-10-19T14:21:54Z;
;

;As ;tens of thousands of people; took to the streets around the world on Oct. 13 in support of the Palestinians, all such protests in Germany and France were banned.

;

;The two countries - home to the European Union's largest Jewish and Muslim communities - have cracked down on pro-Palestinian groups since Hamas militants burst over the border from Gaza and killed more than 1,400 Israelis on Oct. 7.

;

;The governments say the curbs are to stop public disorder and prevent antisemitism.

;

;But supporters of the Palestinians say they feel blocked from publicly expressing support or concern for people in the Hamas-controlled enclave of Gaza without risking arrest, their jobs or immigration status.

;

;More than 3,500 people have been killed in Gaza since Israel launched a campaign of retaliatory bombing, while a blockade that prevents food, fuel and medicine for getting in has created a humanitarian crisis.

;

;"We are scared, we are worried about being accused of justifying terrorism, when we just want to support a humanitarian cause," said Messika Medjoub a 20-year-old French-Algerian history student.

;

;She was speaking at a banned protest in Paris last Thursday which police broke up with teargas and water cannon.

;

;French Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin clamped a nationwide ban on pro-Palestinian protests last week, citing the risk of public disorder. Nine have been banned in Paris since Oct.7.

;

;Over the weekend, Paris police issued a ban on the "presence and circulation of people that present themselves as pro-Palestinian". Since Oct. 12 they have issued 752 fines and arrested 43 people.

;

;In Germany, Berlin police have approved two requests for pro-Palestine protests since the initial Hamas attacks, a police spokesperson said. Both were proposed as silent vigils.

;

;But at least seven, including one called Jewish Berliners Against Middle Eastern Violence and another entitled Youth Against Racism, were refused permission. At least 190 people have been detained at protests.

;

;The French and German governments say they need to protect Jewish communities given a rise in antisemitic violence since the attacks by Hamas, which is deemed a terrorist group by the EU and several countries.

;

;In Germany, the issue is particularly acute because of the killing of six million European Jews in the Holocaust by the Nazis.

;

;"Our history, our responsibility for the Holocaust makes it our duty in every moment to stand for the existence and security of Israel," Chancellor Olaf Scholz told legislators last week.

;

;Darmanin said on Tuesday that 327 antisemitic acts had taken place in France since Oct. 7, with 183 arrests for antisemitism or apologising for terrorism.

;

;Human rights groups say Jewish communities must be protected but they are are concerned legitimate protest is being repressed.

;

;"Human rights law doesn't allow the government to just broadly say there is a concern about violence and use that as a justification to ban protests," said Benjamin Ward, a deputy director at Human Rights Watch.

;

;"The question is whether it's proportionate - and that's where I think there is a concern."

;

;Hungary and Austria have also blocked pro-Palestine protests since Oct.7, while in the rest of Europe large rallies supporting Palestinians have been held with few restrictions.

;

;With an estimated 30,000 Palestinians, Berlin has one of the largest diaspora communities outside the Middle East, and anxiety over what is happening in Gaza is running high.

;

;At an unauthorised protest in Berlin last week, Palestinians who spoke to Reuters said they felt nervous about speaking out, fearful of being labelled pro-Hamas in a country where supporting Israel is sacrosanct.

;

;"I feel that in Germany we're not allowed to speak our mind," said Saleh Said, standing on the fringes of an unauthorised gathering.

;

;A 32-year-old German born to Palestinian parents, he said he condemned Hamas's violence.

;

;Berlin's education authorities last week told schools they could ban students from wearing the Palestinian Kufiya scarf and "free Palestine" stickers.

;

;Post-World War Two German goverments have pursued close ties with Israel because of the Holocaust.

;

;Felix Klein, Germany's ombudsman in charge of fighting antisemitism, said the country's history meant it had to be especially vigilant.

;

;Even before the Hamas attack on Israel, Germany was restricting pro-Palestinian demonstrations, with Berlin authorities banning several on public safety grounds.

;

;Amnesty International said in September that German police's justifications for bans on pro-Palestinian groups appeared to be based on "stigmatizing and discriminatory stereotypes", citing references in police orders to people "from the Arab diaspora, in particular with Palestinian background".

;

;In France pro-Palestinian groups were also facing curbs prior to the attacks.

;

;An attempt last year to ban two organisations - Collectif Palestine Vaincra and Comite Action Palestine - was overruled by a higher court who said their "bold, even virulent" positions did not constitute hate speech or terrorism

;

;Interior Minister Darmanin announced that he had initiated judicial proceedings for "antisemitism, apologia for terrorism and support for Hamas" against 11 organisations, including Collectif Palestine Vaincra and Comite Action Palestine. Both deny the allegations.

;

;On Wednesday, in response to an appeal against Darmanin's instructions, a court said local authorities should ban protests on a case by case basis.

;

;In a memo about one set of protests last week French intelligence services said it would attract "radical elements from the ultra-left, close to Islamist movements and young people from sensitive neighbourhoods".

;

;People who spoke to Reuters at a banned protest in Paris last Thursday said the government's move to prevent gatherings for Palestinians was unfair but unsurprising.

;

;"The government is indulgent when it comes to Israel's crimes. They are being biased and they are showing it," said Hortense La Chance, a 32-year-old cook.

;;美国和韩国军队利用陆军战术导弹系统 (ATACMS) 和韩国 Hyunmoo 导弹 II，向朝鲜海域发射导弹东海，韩国近海，2017 年 7 月 5 日。美国第八陆军/资料来源：路透社/档案照片;
;

;拜登政府可能很快就会开始向乌克兰运送多种陆军战术导弹的变体系统 (ATACMS)，一种远程导弹系统，通常携带不同数量的集束炸弹。

;

;以下信息很大程度上依赖于美国陆军的演示和预算数据。

;

;- M39 Block I ATACMS 是一种射程为 25 至 165 公里（15 至 100 英里）的制导导弹，可携带 950 枚杀伤人员和设备摧毁炸弹。 M39 Block I 于 1991 年加入美国军械库，现已停产。根据陆军文件，大约生产了 1,650 枚，其中数百枚用于沙漠风暴行动和伊拉克自由行动等冲突。其余单位正在现代化改造为不包含集束弹药的版本。五角大楼表示，哑弹率（部署后不会爆炸的分布式弹药的百分比）是保密的。

;

;- M39A1 Block IA ATACMS 部分由 GPS 引导，射程为 70 至 300 公里（ 40 至 190 英里），携带 300 枚 M74 小炸弹的有效载荷。根据陆军文件，共生产了 610 辆，其中约 74 辆用于伊拉克自由行动。 M39 Block IA 于 1997 年加入美国军火库，现已不再生产，其余单位已现代化为不包含集束弹药的版本。五角大楼表示，无用率属于机密。根据路透社对陆军文件和预算文件的审查，由于现场使用和改装计划，库存中剩余的 M39 和 M39A1 弹头不足 1,114 枚。

;

;- M48 ATACMS 可发射一枚 500 磅（230 磅）弹头。 -kg）高爆弹头，射程为 70 至 300 公里（40 至 190 英里）。爆炸将数十万碎片抛向目标区域。根据陆军文件，大约生产了 176 辆，其中大约 55 辆用于沙漠风暴行动和伊拉克自由行动等冲突。 M48 于 2001 年加入美国武库。

;

;- ATACMS M57 可发射一枚 500 磅（230 公斤）高爆弹头，射程为 70 至 300 公里（40 至 190 英里），类似于到M48。根据陆军文件，大约生产了 513 辆，其中约 33 辆用于持久自由行动等冲突。 The M57 debuted in 2004.

;

;- M57A1 has specifications nearly identical to the M57, but the height of the blast can be changed, allowing blast fragments to be disbursed across a larger area.
